1.name: GPIO 40-pin
1.details:
The Raspberry Pi 4B features a 40-pin GPIO header for connecting various peripherals and sensors.

Pinout:
- 40 pins total
- 28 GPIO pins
- 2x 5V power pins
- 8x Ground pins
- 2x 3.3V power pins
- I2C, SPI, UART, PWM interfaces
- HAT ID pins

Compatible with Raspberry Pi HATs and add-on boards.

2.name: Micro HDMI 1
2.details:
First micro HDMI output port for connecting external displays.

Specifications:
- Micro HDMI connector
- Supports up to 4K@60Hz
- HDCP 2.2 support
- Audio output included

Can be used simultaneously with HDMI 2 for dual displays.

3.name: Micro HDMI 2
3.details:
Second micro HDMI output port for dual display setup.

Specifications:
- Micro HDMI connector
- Supports up to 4K@60Hz
- HDCP 2.2 support
- Audio output included

Allows for dual independent displays.

4.name: USB 3.0
4.details:
Two USB 3.0 ports for high-speed peripherals.

Specifications:
- 2x USB 3.0 Type-A ports
- 5Gbps transfer speed
- Backward compatible with USB 2.0
- Provides up to 1.2A per port

Ideal for external storage, high-speed devices.

5.name: USB 2.0
5.details:
Two USB 2.0 ports for general peripherals.

Specifications:
- 2x USB 2.0 Type-A ports
- 480Mbps transfer speed
- Provides up to 1.2A per port

Suitable for keyboards, mice, and other accessories.

6.name: Gigabit Ethernet
6.details:
Gigabit Ethernet port for wired network connection.

Specifications:
- 10/100/1000Mbps auto-sensing
- RJ45 connector
- PoE support with HAT
- Wake-on-LAN support

Provides stable high-speed network connection.

7.name: Camera/CDSI
7.details:
15-pin MIPI CSI-2 interface for camera modules.

Specifications:
- MIPI CSI-2 interface
- 2-lane configuration
- Supports up to 1080p@30fps
- Compatible with Pi cameras

Used for connecting Raspberry Pi camera modules.

8.name: Display/DSI
8.details:
15-pin MIPI DSI interface for displays.

Specifications:
- MIPI DSI interface
- 2-lane configuration
- Supports up to 1080p@60fps
- Touch panel support

For connecting DSI compatible displays.

9.name: 3.5mm AV
9.details:
4-pole 3.5mm jack for audio and composite video.

Features:
- Stereo audio output
- Composite video output
- Microphone input on newer models
- Compatible with standard audio accessories

Note: Video output removed on Pi 4.

10.name: USB-C Power
10.details:
USB-C port for power delivery.

Specifications:
- USB-C power input
- 5V @ 3A minimum
- Supports USB-PD
- Power delivery negotiation

Requires official 5V 3A USB-C power supply.

11.name: Status LEDs
11.details:
LED indicators for system status.

LED functions:
- PWR: Power status (green)
- ACT: Disk activity (green)
- FDX: Full duplex (green)
- LNK: Link status (green)
- 100: 100Mbps link (yellow/amber)

Provides visual feedback for system status.
